content: Hey, @simulacrum and @Pietro Albini : I had impression that the release team had taken steps, or had planned action items at least, to address some of the confusion that led to the fingerprint ICE being miscategorized with 1.53 when it really was in 1.52. Do you have a link to the discussion of those steps/action items? I just now skimmed everthing in #t-release zulip since the 1.52.0 release and nothing stood out at me as a definitive list.
(its possible the discussion was on a completely different stream, of course. I'm just not a position to skim all zulip traffic over that time period)
Hm, I'm not sure we're actively taking steps to particularly tackle that confusion (beyond "well, check harder if you want to be certain")
the main points of order are in issues on https://github.com/rust-lang/release-team
that said, we are loosely planning steps to keep a better eye on regressions that we do know about
perfect, https://github.com/rust-lang/release-team/issues/10 is I think what I was looking for, thanks!
There's also been some talk about increasing our asks for people to use beta if they can locally so we can get more reports
or having pre-releases earlier in the cycle
none of those ideas have crystallized yet though
@pnkfelix also, we asked github to enable for us the new issues beta
hopefully that'll have better support for what we need
can't see a way to create new beta projects
Yeah, task lists are also enabled for cg_clif.
#NNNN also filling in the issue/PR title is really nice
But unfortunately not really preserved e.g. in a commit message referencing the issue, so you'll end up with duplication there.
